all-sessions.title: Registration & Welcome Breakfast
all-sessions.content: Participant registration, enjoy welcome breakfast, initial networking

all-sessions.title: Opening Remarks
all-sessions.content: GOSIM representative or host opening remarks, agenda introduction

all-sessions.title: Keynote 1: Restructuring Learning Paradigms in the Age of AI — From Knowledge Acquisition to Creative Generation
all-sessions.content: AI is reshaping human learning mechanisms and the structure of knowledge systems, shifting education away from a knowledge-centered paradigm toward one driven by creative production and cognitive collaboration. This topic explores the tension between AI as a "cognitive partner" versus an "algorithmic supervisor," and examines its implications for educational equity, privacy, and the evolving role of teachers. It also considers institutional and technological pathways for achieving knowledge democratization.

speakers.name: Salim NAHLE
speakers.roleOrg: Head of Department of Data and Artificial Intelligence, Associate Professor, EFREI Paris Panthéon-Assas

Lunch, AIGC Spotlight awards ceremony and showcase

Special Session: 'Technical Products' and 'Artistic Creativity' dual-unit global showcase

all-sessions.title: Keynote 2: From Automated Tools to Human-AI Symbiotic Systems — The Evolving Role of Artificial Intelligence
all-sessions.content: AI has progressed beyond being a mere tool, increasingly influencing human behavior, cognition, and value formation. This topic addresses the symbiotic paradox—"Are we training AI, or is AI training us?"—while critically examining technology dependence, its erosion of human agency, and the theoretical foundations and societal frameworks necessary for designing complementary human-AI collaboration systems.

speakers.name: Li Jianzhong
speakers.roleOrg: President of Singularity Intelligence Research Institute, Senior Vice President of CSDN

speakers.name: Du Kai
speakers.roleOrg: Assistant Professor of Psychology and Cognitive Science, Tsinghua University

speakers.name: Nicolas Flores Herr
speakers.roleOrg: Team Lead Foundation Models & Gen AI Systems, Fraunhofer IAIS

speakers.name: Mano Joseph MATHEW
speakers.roleOrg: Head of Health Tech & AI & Biology Department, Associate Professor, EFREI Paris Panthéon-Assas

speakers.name: Kuang Kun
speakers.roleOrg: Associate Professor, PhD Supervisor, Deputy Director of AI Department, School of Computer Science, Zhejiang University

speakers.name: Zhao Simiao
speakers.roleOrg: CEO of Pawmed, PhD Candidate in AI Medicine at Oxford University

speakers.name: Liu Qunkai

speakers.name: Zhao Weiqi
speakers.roleOrg: Senior Product Technology Director & Head of Global Developer Ecosystem, Rokid

all-sessions.title: Keynote 3: Ethical Paradoxes and Governance of AI — Norms and Practices from a Global Perspective
all-sessions.content: As AI technology rapidly advances, ethical governance frameworks struggle to keep pace. Who is accountable for algorithmic injustice, data privacy breaches, or misuse? This topic investigates the ethical tensions that arise across cultural and institutional boundaries, calls for anticipatory, inclusive, and enforceable governance mechanisms, and advocates for formats like "black-box debates" to enhance transparency and public engagement in AI systems.

speakers.name: Florent Zara
speakers.bio: Advocate for open source AI at the Eclipse Foundation. Serves as topic moderator, fostering collaboration and dialogue across global AI communities.

speakers.name: Yang Qingfeng
speakers.roleOrg: Professor & Researcher, China Association for Science and Technology-Fudan University Institute of Science and Technology Ethics and Human Future
speakers.bio: PhD in Philosophy, doctoral supervisor at Fudan University. Specializes in technology philosophy and AI ethics research. Former visiting scholar at Dartmouth College. Currently serves as executive director of Professional Committee of Philosophy of Technology and CCF Ethics Committee member. Has led 3 National Social Science Foundation projects and published 4 monographs.

speakers.name: Dr. Cailean Osborne
speakers.bio: Cailean Osborne, PhD, is a Senior Researcher at the Linux Foundation, leading work on open source AI strategy, governance, and community resources. Formerly at the UK Government's Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation, he co-authored the UK's AI Strategy and has a PhD from Oxford.

speakers.name: Jesse McCrosky
speakers.bio: Jesse McCrosky is Principal Architect for Gen AI at Egen, focused on building AI governance systems. He emphasizes transparency, bias mitigation, and responsible governance as catalysts for both innovation and social value.

speakers.name: Xiaohu Zhu
speakers.bio: Founder of the Center for Safe AGI, leading efforts to align advanced AI power with collective human safety and long-term stewardship.

speakers.name: Christian Maitre
speakers.bio: Former VP of Innovation at Orange, Christian has led digital and sustainability initiatives across telecom and smart cities. As CEO of Caspera-Lab, he now focuses on guiding organizations toward digital transformation and global excellence.

all-sessions.title: Tea Break
all-sessions.content: Free discussion and networking, enjoy Hangzhou Longjing tea

all-sessions.title: Keynote 4: Building Artificial Intelligence as a Global Digital Public Good — Vision, Pathways, and Cooperation
all-sessions.content: AI is increasingly becoming a core part of global infrastructure, raising urgent questions about its accessibility, sustainability, and public accountability. Framed through the lens of "global digital public goods," this topic explores open collaboration models, governance frameworks, and how AI can align with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), promoting cross-border cooperation and long-term institutional arrangements.

speakers.name: Emily Chen
speakers.bio: Emily Chen is the co-founder of KAIYUANSHE, one of China's leading open-source advocacy organizations. She plays a key role in promoting open-source culture and international collaboration between Chinese and global tech communities.

speakers.name: Dr. Mehdi Snene
speakers.bio: Dr. Mehdi Snene is an AI Advisor at the UN Office of Digital Economy and Technology (ODET). He specializes in AI ethics, digital transformation, and public sector innovation. Formerly a professor at the University of Geneva.

speakers.name: Sameer Chauhan
speakers.bio: Sameer Chauhan is the Director of the UN International Computing Centre (UNICC). He leads digital innovation across the UN system and brings over two decades of global leadership from firms like Deutsche Bank and Credit Suisse.

speakers.name: Emily Bennett
speakers.bio: Emily Bennett leads the UN's Digital Public Solutions unit. She focuses on building open-source digital public infrastructure to support inclusive development and digital cooperation across nations.

speakers.name: Carlos Correia
speakers.bio: Carlos J. Correia is a senior IT architect at UNICC, driving cloud-native infrastructure, platform engineering, and digital foundations for inter-agency digital transformation.

speakers.name: Dr. Yonghua Lin
speakers.bio: Dr. Yonghua Lin is Vice President at the Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI), where he leads research strategy in large-scale AI models and collaborative innovation across academia and industry.

speakers.name: Prof. Qin Wang
speakers.bio: Professor Qin Wang is a senior academic at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences (CASS), with expertise in technology ethics, digital governance, and the intersection of AI with societal development.

speakers.name: Richard Bian (Si-Kang Bian)
speakers.role: Director of Strategy and Product, OSS (Panelist)
speakers.bio: Richard Bian leads open-source strategy and product at Ant Group. He champions global OSS collaboration and is active in building community-led fintech and AI ecosystems across Asia and beyond.

all-sessions.title: Dinner
all-sessions.content: Enjoy dinner at West Lake State Guest House with views of West Lake
